title: Signing URLs for improved security
body:
Pippin asked me to go ahead and open an issue here for discussion on a new implementation for improving the security of URLs that I built out as an add-on at the moment. Considering the implications of something like this, it'd be ideal to roll it into the core plugin, but may require breaking some currently valid URLs.

The basic premise is that URLs can be signed using a unique string, in this case `wp_salt()`, and when requested, the token can be checked to ensure none of the variables in the query string have been tampered with. This allows for passing non-sensitive data through the URL in the clear and being certain that it hasn't been changed. It essentially allows for more secure and concise URLs.

### Code

My implementation is available here for anyone wanting to try it out and offer feedback on how it could be improved or integrated: https://github.com/bradyvercher/EDD-Signed-URLs

The first three functions simply hook into EDD to modify and check the URLs, while the last three functions provide the API for signing URLs.

The concept will work with any URL structure, so my method of condensing everything into a colon delimited `eddfile` query arg isn't required (and that arg could even be renamed with a simple filter if desired).

### Breakage

As far as potentially breaking changes, existing URLs that haven't expired would quit working with this solution. It might be possible to run things side by side for a short while, but the current method would need to be deprecated at some point.

This would also decrease the reliance on using the `download_key` to look up a payment, instead using actual payment IDs, which might make things a little easier to work with. In that case, the current API utilizing the `download_key` might need to be augmented, or a new solution could be run side by side. I'm not sure if anyone is using the existing functions directly or not.

### Improvements

In any case, we're opening this up to see if anyone has ideas on implementing a solution like this without breaking anything. Feedback about improvements, suggestions on the default URL structure (is it worth trying to simplify?), and increasing security is welcome.

Feel free to correct me if I got anything wrong, Pippin.

title: generic linear-algebra functions for Number types (e.g. BigFloat)
body:
It would be nice to have linear-algebra functions for `BigFloat` (possibly as an external package?) and other generic `Number` types.

Currently, `\` on a `BigFloat` converts to `Float64`; `eig` and `qr` don't work at all.

The good news is that LINPACK-style triple-loop textbook implementations (straight out of Trefethen or Golub & Van Loan) should mostly suffice.  Since `BigFloat` operations are CPU-limited rather than memory-limited, there is no reason to implement a LAPACK/BLAS-style blocked algorithm.

cc: @andrioni

title: utf8=✓ is always included in Ruby RAILS forms, triggers 41_sql_injection_attacks
body:
CORERULES-91: Apparently (I'm no expert in Ruby on RAILS and I've just started with mod_security) it's normal for RAILS to include a hidden element in all it's webforms. The argument then gets passed on as utf8=✓, along with the other ones. 

This is done on purpose, apparently to force some brain-dead browser to submit data in UTF-8.

It however triggers 41_sql_injection_attacks:

[error] ModSecurity: Access denied with code 403 (phase 2). Pattern match "(^[\\"'`\\xc2\\xb4\\xe2\\x80\\x99\\xe2\\x80\\x98;]+|[\\"'`\\xc2\\xb4\\xe2\\x80\\x99\\xe2\\x80\\x98;]+$)" at ARGS:utf8. [file "/etc/httpd/modsecurity.d/activated_rules/modsecurity_crs_41_sql_injection_attacks.conf"] [line "64"] [id "981318"] [rev "2.2.5"] [msg "SQL Injection Attack: Common Injection Testing Detected"] [data "\\xe2"] [severity "CRITICAL"] [tag "WEB_ATTACK/SQL_INJECTION"] [tag "WASCTC/WASC-19"] [tag "OWASP_TOP_10/A1"] [tag "OWASP_AppSensor/CIE1"] [tag "PCI/6.5.2"] 

I have no idea (yet) how to add this as an exception, but it seems to me, as this match will basically break any and all Rails apps, it's eligible for a permanent fix (which shouldn't be hard since it's always that single character in that single argument) in the CRS.

title: ENH: sparse: speedup LIL matrix slicing
body:
The current implementation for slicing LIL matrices is very pessimal. Replace it with a more optimal implementation.

Gives a factor of ~1/density speedup:
```
In []: A = rand(3000, 3000, density=1e-3, format="lil")

# Before (9ccc68475)
In [4]: %timeit A[::2,::-2]
10 loops, best of 3: 87.5 ms per loop

# After (d47e27b0)
In [4]: %timeit A[::2,::-2]
1000 loops, best of 3: 603 µs per loop
```
Gives speedups also for smaller slices:
```
# Before
In [5]: %timeit A[3,:]
1000 loops, best of 3: 213 µs per loop
In [6]: %timeit A[:,3]
1000 loops, best of 3: 901 µs per loop
In [7]: %timeit A[1:5,1:5]
10000 loops, best of 3: 83.3 µs per loop

# After
In [5]: %timeit A[3,:]
10000 loops, best of 3: 38.8 µs per loop
In [6]: %timeit A[:,3]
1000 loops, best of 3: 702 µs per loop
In [7]: %timeit A[1:5,1:5]
10000 loops, best of 3: 40.3 µs per loop
```
(Column slices in LIL are still problematic, but that's due to the matrix format.)

**EDIT** updated benchmarks

title: Stop bundling mpmath
body:
```
Bundling mpmath causes problems for interoperation with user code and libraries using mpmath themselves (cf. discussions about this in issue 5259 ). It's also a problem for porting to Python3, as mpmath uses the same source under Python2 and 3, while we want to use 2to3, but no existing tool allows to mix the two approaches inside a single package.

So, I think that we should make mpmath an external dependency and remove it from our source tree. To specify the dependency properly, we'll need to port our setup.py to Distribute. I have a branch that does all this: https://github.com/rlamy/sympy/tree/unbundle-mpmath - it's not quite polished enough for a pull request but it works under tox (though not in python2.4, because mpmath 0.17 is incompatiblme with it).
```
Original issue for #5581: http://code.google.com/p/sympy/issues/detail?id=2482
Original author: https://code.google.com/u/101272611947379421629/
Referenced issues: #5259
Original owner: https://code.google.com/u/101272611947379421629/

title: DEPR: remove code for deprecations from prior versions
body:
# For 0.15
- [x] `DataFrame.delevel` already deprecated in 0.7

# For 0.16
- [ ] boxplot https://github.com/pydata/pandas/pull/7096
  - [ ] change default of `return_type` from None to `'axes'`
  - [ ] update return_type section in visualization.rst
- [ ] #5505, DataFrame.pivot_table and crosstab were refactored to use the same arguments as pivot (index and columns) and FutureWarnings added for the old arguments.  Per @jreback, in 0.16, these deprecated arguments should be removed and the docstring updated.  This issue is submitted as a reminder to do so and should be tagged with a 0.156 milestone.
- [ ] #6686, cols was deprecated in DataFrame.to_excel and to_csv (rows is not deprecated, don't touch it!)
- [ ] #8140, remove `covert_dummies` from `core/reshape` entirely. Deprecated in favor of enhanced `get_dummies`. Deprecated as of 0.15
- [ ] #8481, remove ``pandas.tools.util.py/value_range``

# Future
- [ ] #6680, cols was deprecated in DataFrame.to_duplicated and drop_duplicates
- [ ] #5231 ``na_last`` arg from Series.sort
- [ ] #4950 - ``rolling_corr_pairwise()``,  ``expanding_corr_pairwise()`` replace by ``rolling_corr()``, ``expanding_corr()``
- [ ] #2304 Deprecate broadcasting TimeSeries along DataFrame index
- [ ] #6815/#6813 ``.freq`` in ``Timestamp`` rather than ``.offset`` (internally used)
- [ ] #3787 Deprecate load and save in favor of pickle and to_pickle
- [ ]  #4853, #4864 Deprecate timeRule and offset in favor of freq ()  
- [ ]  Deprecate colSpace in favor of col_space (no issue, commit 4a5a677c)  
- [ ] #3822, #3817 Deprecate year/month parameters in finance option signatures
- [ ]  #4713 Remove kind from read_excel
- [ ]  #4770, #7032 Deprecate infer_types to have no effect
- [ ]  #4645 Deprecate table keyword in HDFStore
- [ ]  #4892 Float indexers in non-float indexes.
- [ ] #6919 Remove ``copy`` keyword from ``xs``,``minor_xs``,``major_xs`` (4 places)
- [ ]  #6910 Change `Panel.shift`'s signature to match `generic.shift()`'s
- [ ] #6930 factorize took an `order` argument but didn't do anything with it.
- [ ] #7088 Deprecate percentile_width in favor of percentiles
- [ ] remove `TimeSeries` alias
- [ ] #8376 remove ``.levels`` from ``Categorical`` constructor / accessor
- [ ] #8486 remove ``outtype`` in ``.to_dict()`` replaced by ``orient``
- [ ] #8227 '+'/'-' for Index set ops

title: Error thrown from example
body:
I ran the following example on Windows 7 with R 3.1.0 and got the following error (love this package idea):

```
library(devtools)
## install_github("hrbrmstr/ggcounty")
library(ggcounty)

# built-in US population by FIPS code data set
data(population)

# define appropriate (& nicely labeled) population breaks
population$brk <- cut(population$count, 
                      breaks=c(0, 100, 1000, 10000, 100000, 1000000, 10000000), 
                      labels=c("0-99", "100-1K", "1K-10K", "10K-100K", 
                               "100K-1M", "1M-10M"),
                      include.lowest=TRUE)

# get the US counties map (lower 48)
us <- ggcounty.us()

# start the plot with our base map
gg <- us$g

# add a new geom with our population (choropleth)

                    aes(map_id=FIPS, fill=brk), 
                    color="white", size=0.125)

# define nice colors
```

title: Duplicate logs
body:
When I try to use logspout, I see duplicate logs arrive in papertrail, and it seems that the log is truly being sent twice to papertrail (i.e. the problem is not on papertrail's end). Here is my setup:

```bash
$ sudo docker -v
Docker version 1.0.1, build 990021a

$ sudo docker run --rm -e "DEBUG=1" -h="logspout-test" -v=/var/run/docker.sock:/tmp/docker.sock progrium/logspout syslog://logs.papertrailapp.com:xxxxx
```

In another terminal,

```
$ sudo docker run --rm flynn/busybox echo hello world
hello world
```

The logspout output:

```
2014/06/26 21:30:57 attach: 64811a11783c success
2014/06/26 21:30:57 routing all to syslog://logs.papertrailapp.com:xxxxx
2014/06/26 21:30:57 loading and persisting routes in /mnt/routes
2014/06/26 21:30:57 logspout serving http on :8000
2014/06/26 21:31:03 event: 33a4cd018d64 create
```

title: Input parsing formats
body:
Here is the chemkin parser in the new parsing design.
There are two/three levels in this design:
  - the read_reaction_data, templated around a parser
  - the parser itself,
  - if needed, low-level methods for the parsers (tiny_xml for the xml parser, none needed for chemkin)

The global high-level method is somewhat clumsy, a little bit too much adapted to the xml parser, nothing really serious, but I keep an option to make it more elegant and standardize a bit more the parsers.
A noteworthy thing is that though it's not paranoid (yet), it already won't let a parser get away with a bad unit or bad representation, this is a good point for any parser wanted in the future, there is no need to know in details what's happening to have something that works cleanly.

The chemkin parser is not exhaustive, but it's fully operable with the file I have from combustion (added in the inputs for the test) and others I've seen  Basically you'll have ``standard'' kinetics with it.  I've finally choose the option to write it almost from scratch, please have a look at the *ascii_getline* method (src/utilities/include/antioch/string_utils.h).  It's basically a *getline* method that deals with the different end-of-line a file can contain, and clearly the chemkin file I had started its life on Windows.  This is something to be expected I guess.  Anyway, I want at the very least an approval of this method before anything happens.

Also it lacks a little bit of documentation, stating for instance that no photochemistry is supported by the chemkin parser, that the weird SRI falloff is not supported either, stuffs like that we might want to deal with in the futur.

title: Ability to catch and rewrite backend's tab-completion responses
body:
###### The issue:
It is not currently possible to catch tab-completion responses from backend servers (e.g. Spigot) to clients. However, this would be a helpful feature, since currently, to block tab-completion responses, server owners have to install a plugin on every backend server. 
###### Problems:
- [x] I have already created (nearly) working code<sup>[1]</sup> to resolve above issue, but I am unable to get it to write changes in the suggestions back to the packet. I have thought of possible fixes for that, but couldn't find any clean ones: 
  - writing to `buf` directly from the `DownstreamBridge#handle(TabCompleteResponse)` method would require a reference to the `PacketWrapper`
  - re-writing the `buf` in `#handle(PacketWrapper)` would require an ugly `instanceof` or handling in `EntityMap`
  - Changes in the API to allow for this would probably not be accepted just to support such a small event that I am not sure how many people could actually use.
- [x] I am not sure if this kind of event suits the goal of BungeeCord, ~~since I have not been able to find any code that rewrites backend->client (except `EntityMap`, but that's something else).~~

###### Use cases:
 - Block commands blocked by users from appearing in tab completions globally, reducing administration effort of copying configuration files for [xxyy/CommandBlockerUltimate](https://github.com/xxyy/CommandBlockerUltimate)
 - Block names of vanished players globally (thanks @Schmoller)
 - Keep Spigot backend tab completions while adding or removing your own stuffs 
 -  completes  the tab complete API with a counterpart to `TabCompleteEvent`.

###### Relevant links:
- [I wanted to put something else here, but I forgot what, so take a link to the related plugin](https://github.com/xxyy/commandblockerultimate/)

<sup>[1]</sup> ~~I accidentally the imports, I will fix that once I get the confirmation that this PR has the chance of being pulled.~~

What I want to ask you for is clarification on whether such changes would be suitable for BungeeCord and, if so, some advice on properly writing back changes. 

*Thanks.*

[Enhancement] Option to only keep the latest files for each package in the _output folder
body:
Currently the package updater creates a folder for each package version in _output. When the _output folder is checked into a Git repository, this is unnecessary and only results in a more bloated repository. Git is already a versioning system, so it would be straightforward to version the package versions in the _output folder with Git.

Therefore an option to do that and to make an automatic commit after each package update would be nice.

title: Color channel order is inconstant across platforms.
body: The order of the colors in OpenFL's BitmapData class should be ARGB, and set to big endian. However, the getPixels() call returns a ByteArray that has RGBA, and still set to big endian. Because the alpha channel is now on the other side of the color channels, it's not an endian problem. Although OpenFL displays what it loads  through Lime correctly, the app's interpretation of the pixel will be incorrect for apps that directly manipulate or generate pixel information because they will expect it to be in ARGB.

title: Default Firefox path for jpm doesn't work on Ubuntu
body:
I'm running Ubuntu 14.04 with Firefox 34.0a2 (2014-09-22)
----
While trying to run 'jpm test' on a new add-in created with 'jpm init,' I receive the following output (minus formatting and JPM header at the beginning):

```bash
Running test on Desktop
The `version` entry must be specified, and it should follow semantic
versioning rules.

http://semver.org

XPI created at /tmp/jid1-5RUIvXqVSOhnMw@jetpack.xpi (13605ms)
Error: spawn ENOENT
[object Object]
```
I couldn't figure out what was going on at first. I eventually ran 'jpm test -v' and noticed something: the path being used by jpm test was /usr/lib64/firefox. /usr/lib64/firefox is not where the Firefox binary is on Ubuntu; instead it's in /usr/bin/firefox (might be symlinked elsewhere too).

Ideally jpm should figure out where the firefox installation is on the system and use that for tests. How we could handle cases where there are multiple versions installed is not entirely clear to me.

As a mitigation, it would be nice if jpm checked for the firefox installation and provided a useful error message so people would know what the problem actually is. I just stumbled on this by running jpm test -v but that shouldn't be necessary.

title: Admin activation of users by email link not working if logged in to frontend
body:
#### Steps to reproduce the issue

Set up user registration to require admin to activate new users. Login to frontend as administrator in your default browser. In other browser create a new user. Once you receive the "verification" link, at the new user email address, copy and paste the link in the other browser, not your default one (where you logged in with your admin user) Click on the activation link. 

#### Expected result

 When successful, we got the message "The user's account has been successfully activated and the user has been notified about it."

#### Actual result

The default browser just shows the site frontend without message that the user has been activated.

#### System information (as much as possible)

Joomla 2.5.28-dev

#### Additional comments

Initial issue Submitted By: Torben Wölm - Open Date: 2013-09-14 03:55:07
http://joomlacode.org/gf/project/joomla/tracker/?action=TrackerItemEdit&tracker_item_id=32007&start=0

I can reproduce the issue on 2.5.28-dev, it is still there. But it has been fixed in 3.3.x but with different PRs, revert from regression. Please help me to find what code should be back ported from 3.3.x, if possible, to fix this in 2.5.x!

title: Trick for automatically serializing eagerly loaded associations?
body: Just a minor issue that I'm struggling with at the moment. It appears that the default instance implementation of toJSON detects and automatically serializes any eagerly loaded associations on the model. However, the name that the associations are loaded under is the capitalized and pluralized name of the association. So if I have a 'Topic' model with a 'Category' association such that `Topic.belongsTo(Category)`, if I eagerly load the category with the topic, I get `topic.Category`. Obviously this is a trivial example but I'm wondering if there is some way to access a list of eagerly loaded associations from within the toJSON() instance method so that I can programmatically rename and serialize all of the eagerly loaded associations?

title: Multiple logging channels
body:
Add a config file named logging.yml, syntax very similar to that of Symfony 2.

```yml
channels:
  default:
    handlers: [main, syslog]

handlers:
  main:
    type: fingers_crossed
    level: warning
    handler: debuglog
  errlog:
    type: stream
    path: /var/log/my_application.error.log
    level: error
  debuglog:
    type: stream
    path: /var/log/my_application.debug.log
    level: debug
  syslog:
    type: syslog
    level: error
```

When injecting a logger into your classes, you don't want to type-hint the class that contains all the different logging channels, you just want to type-hint Psr\Log\LoggerInterface. Need to come up with a way to easily tell the container what channel you want without having to re-define the entire class factory - see #50

title: adding newsyslog user and group permission for jenkins user
body:
This fix is based on this issue: https://issues.jenkins-ci.org/browse/JENKINS-23543

Essentially, when newsyslog runs it will change the log to have root permissions. This will cause jenkins to silently fail and to not be able to restart on OSX. 

I have tested this change on Yosemite, Mavericks, and Mountain Lion.

title: Addition of some popular features
body:
1) Seconds field is now optional and Dow field is mandatory to support standard GNU/Linux crontab format.

2) An optional TZ=<Location> clause (ex : TZ=Europe/London) in the beginning of cron spec to support specification of cron times in that location rather than in the local timezone

Sample usage :
c := cron.New()
c.AddFunc("TZ=Europe/London 07 21 * * *", func() { fmt.Println("Runs at 21:07 London time") }, "London test") 
c.Start()

3) Added a function NextNTimes for Entry struct which returns next (upto) N activation times.

4) Added DST support and test cases from github.com/lukescott/cron feature-dst branch

5) Added safe Remove() and its test cases.

title: future of rails_autolink
body:
I think the initial goal of rails_autolink was to provide the functionality that was removed from rails. To that end it has served its purpose well.

Is there any interest from the maintainers in keeping the project going and advancing it? We can make API- and behavior-changing improvements for the next version, and also improve the implementation.

This project, even thought it's pretty simple and small, still seems to do the best job of parsing text for a wide variety of URLs in user-entered content.

Here are things I would like to see improved.

## more modular code and, by extension, features

For example, the project provides a good link detector/extractor. I'm "hacking" it to use this functionality in a standalone manner.

```ruby
@urls = []
Autolinker.instance.auto_link(text, link: :urls) do |url|
  @urls << url
  ""
end
```

If there were official support for this feature, it could have a nicer API and also be more efficient.

## dealing with html vs. non-html input

This project very ambitiously detects URLs that are already within `a` tags and doesn't link them again. I don't know what the use case is for dealing with content that might have a mix of linked and not-linked URLs, but I certainly don't have one. Because of this complicated code, it makes it more difficult to add other features. I would propose either making support for html input an optional, separate phase, or, I prefer, removing it entirely, if we poll current users and find that this feature is not commonly used.

## more correct notion of "sanitization"

Currently sanitization will both remove unapproved html tags, and also html-escape all (I believe) the output. But what if I don't want to worry about unsafe html tags, but I do want the output (in particular, the values of the "href" attribute) to be html-escaped? There's no way to do this.

Thoughts?

If the maintainers think that some or all of these are ideas are appropriate for rails_autolink 2, maybe we can make a branch and I'll start submitting patches.


/cc @xuanxu @tenderlove @tardate

title: Implement Tabs component
body:
![screen shot 2014-11-11 at 15 26 29](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/110953/4995210/2143c9a2-69b7-11e4-9db0-ff4154f8e4b7.png)

* Tabs are presented as a single row.
* Tabs should not be nested. Content in a tab should not consist of another set of tabbed content.
* A set of tabs contains at minimum a pair of tabs and no more than six tabs.
* Tabs control the display of content in a consistent location.
* The tab corresponding to the visible content is highlighted.
* Tabs are grouped together and the group of tabs is in turn connected with their content.

body:
Your Tropical Beach biome ID (value 55) cannot be configured via the configuration file, so this value collides with the default value from Biomes O Plenty for Deciduous Forest, which can be corrected by changing BOP's default value.  

Also, in the comments in the configuration file for the Dino Terrain biome ID, the details say that the mod adds only 4 Dino biomes, but there appears to now be 5 - Dino Plains, Dino Mountains, Dino Ocean, Dino Island with Dino Jungle as the latest it looks like.  So if using the default configuration values for biome ids, then Dino Jungle gets the value that the configs say is the first value for the IceAgeTerrain (46) and the 4th Ice Age biome (Ice Islands) is now at value 50, not 49 as the comments would make you think.

title: Constants don't always play right with loading/reloading.
body:
First reported here: https://github.com/enigma-dev/enigma-dev/pull/864

If you are working on a new file and you edit constants, they work fine:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RTRMchiFzCg&feature=youtu.be

However, if you are editing an existing file, the constants will never sync right. For example:
1. Make a new, empty game. Save it as something.egm.
2. Close, then re-open LGM. Open something.egm.
3. Add some constants. They will not be reflected to the output file.

*Edit:* I should add that this works regardless of format. Say, if you open an existing .gmd file with constants.

Additionally, such a layer of indirection could make sure that old versions still check out cleanly even if the original URLs have long since rotted away. Decoupling the _what version of which depencency_ from _where to get it_ is pretty much my favorite thing about Cocoapods.

title: Updater is broken
body:
Our updater is broken (or: I have strong suspicions it is).
According to `version-0.6.0`, we check the version present on FEX based on that file being listed on [this page](http://www.mathworks.de/matlabcentral/fileexchange/22022-matlab2tikz/all_files).

But that page no longer exists, as you can see. Either we need to find a different mechanism (e.g. we could use a similar mechanism on GitHub), or we may want to look for an alternative on FEX (e.g. 

Anyway, we still want to download everything through FEX: that link should still work, and it has the added advantage that we then keep track of our popularity in FEX.
Unfortunately, this situation also means that our end-users are currently unable to get notified of updates. However, we are still 7th most popular package with about 1200 downloads per month, so there is no reason for panic :smile:

title: Backends are reimported each time find() is called with backend parameter None
body:
If find() is called multiple times with backend=None, the backend is reimported and consequently the backend library is reinitalized.  For libusb, this results in libusb_init() and libusb_exit() getting called on each call to find() and renders the backend module's mechanism for caching the library (i.e. the global "_lib" variable) useless.

On windows, this was somehow leading to the intermittent "Access Denied" errors as detailed here: http://sourceforge.net/p/pyusb/mailman/message/33076849/

An easy workaround is for the caller to get the specific backend once, cache it themselves, and pass it explicitly.

title: piaware blocks waiting for netstat output
body:
netstat without -n can take a long time to complete (minutes!) as it needs to do reverse-DNS on potentially a long list of addresses, many of which might time out.

piaware blocks while it waits for this output, which isn't great.

Best option would be to pass -n, but you'd have to do something about explicitly looking for "eyes.flightaware.com" then.

title: Python
body:
I think you would have a lot of success if you had a python tool available @ [pypi](https://pypi.python.org/pypi).  From a systems admin perspective, this format could be very useful.  A good deal of text based object configuration goes on, and on a daily basis.  YAML is fine sure, but why not have the option to try something else.

Python has a pretty active community.  If you just threw together something scrappy, I'm betting people would clean it up pretty quickly.

The JavaScript community is going to be naturally hesitant to something like this.  Mainly because it is "suggestive" about standards.

Just a thought!

First, the GCE API uses oauth2 with refresh tokens. My current implementation caches tokens in driver.storePath, but this is obviously deleted when a machine is rm'ed, and only applies to a single machine. Would you be opposed to caching them one level up? So .docker/hosts/gce/ instead of .docker/hosts/gce//

Second, my test is more of an integration test and actually creates/rm's a machine. It's currently failing travis because it needs a real project ID to run against. Are you interested in having this kind of test? If so, how do you want me to block it from the travis run?

Signed-off-by: Dan Lorenc <lorenc.d@gmail.com>

title: getObjectsUnderPoint() returns wrong value (html5 & neko)
endless loop in rrule.py
body:
There is a bug in rrule.py (dateutil 2.3). The `while True` loop on line 659 does not always terminate:
```python
elif freq == HOURLY:
    if filtered:
        # Jump to one iteration before next day
        hour += ((23-hour)//interval)*interval
    while True:
        hour += interval
        div, mod = divmod(hour, 24)
        if div:
            hour = mod
            day += div
            fixday = True
        if not byhour or hour in byhour:
            break
```
Here's an example:
If the initial value of `hour` is an odd number, say `23`, and the `byhour` tuple is, e.g., `(0, 6, 12, 18)`, then we have an endless loop if `interval` is even because `hour` will always be odd and, hence, `hour in byhour` is never `True`!

Because dateutil is used by matplotlib, this causes some plotting routines to freeze.

title: Don't add executable dependencies to link ones
body:
At some point executable dependencies will need dedicated "pathDependency"
support. For now those better be ignored - no one is going to link against
an executable.

Without this fix adding dependency with `targetType : executable` resulted
in broken DFLAGS generated because binary name from dependency was added to
the linker flags as if it was a static library.

title: regexPrintClose failing under Windows unless implicit newline following {{ }}
body:
Commit 11d31911b85a00ccfe042b8aa6465c14fc2f28c7 has caused an issue under Windows (8.1 x86_64) where the following would evaluate fine:

{{hello}}

, but the following would fail:

{{hello}}

with the error: com.mitchellbosecke.pebble.error.ParserException: Unexpected "}" (hello.peb:1) This is because commit 11d31911b85a00ccfe042b8aa6465c14fc2f28c7 changed the newline character in LexerImpl to `String newline = Pattern.quote(System.lineSeparator());`. Having the old `\\n` (before the commit) works fine.

title: Chrome on Windows disables non-web store HTTPS Everywhere on restart
body:
Steps to reproduce:

1. In Chrome on Windows, install HTTPS Everywhere directly from EFF (download the .crx, drag and drop into Extensions page).
2. Restart Chrome.

Expected result:

HTTPS Everywhere stays installed.

Actual result:

On next startup, a notice appears in the upper right saying "Unsupported extensions disabled. To make Chrome safer, we disabled some extensions that aren't listed in the Chrome Web Store and may have been added without your knowledge.

 - HTTPS Everywhere"

On the Extensions page, HTTPS Everywhere is greyed out, disabled, and the checkbox to re-enable it is greyed out. Enabling developer mode doesn't fix it, nor does dragging in the .crx again. Deleting the extension and dragging back in the .crx works until the next restart.

We should ask Google about this.

title: Run individual methods with junit48
body:
This implements a method filter for the junit 4.8 provider that supports the same syntax as discussed in <https://jira.codehaus.org/browse/SUREFIRE-745> and documented in <http://maven.apache.org/surefire/maven-surefire-plugin/examples/single-test.html#Running_a_Set_of_Methods_in_a_Single_Test_Class>. That ticket apparently only contained an implementation for the junit 4.0 provider and only handled one or two methodss per class.

I still have to add tests for this functionality. Would unit tests just for the method filter, using mocked Descriptions, be enough or do you also require integration tests? If so I would need some pointers to how the setup of integration tests inside surefire itself would work.

Let me know what you think of this approach.

title: return URL is not preserved after login failure page reload
body:
#### Steps to reproduce the issue

Setup a site with guest and registered type of users with a standard login access on a menu item. Non-registered users should be given guest permissions.
Define a menu item that can only be accessed with registered user rights.
Try to access this menu item by providing the URL directly without being logged in.
Now the login form should appear.

Try to log in with an existing user **but wrong password**.
You should get an error message.
Now try to log in with the correct password.

#### Expected result
You are redirected to the target menu link.

#### Actual result
You are **not** redirected to the target menu link.

#### System information (as much as possible)
Joomla 2.5.19, basic setup with guest and registered users

#### Additional comments
The reason for this is that the return URL which is passed in the form as a hidden input parameter is not preserved after reloading the login page due to the login error.

Operators and [Double] support for beCloseTo matching
body:
In a nutshell:
```
expect(1.0) ~= 1.0001
expect(1.0) == (1.002, 0.005)
expect(1.0) == 0.9 ± 0.2
```
I've also added matching of Double arrays (identical delta for all elements):
```
expect([0.0, 1.0]) ~= [0.0001, 1.0001]                       // using the default delta of 0.0001
expect([0.0, 1.0]).to(beCloseTo([0.1, 1.1], within: 0.1))    // using the given delta of 0.1
```

title: The results should only be visible after people have voted.
body:
This is the first of the feedback from my father.

At the moment the triangle with the result is placed as soon as someone opens the page. This is confusing (especially because people do not know what the triangle means). Also if people were to understand the triangle it would have a bias effect, affecting how people voted. Also later in the voting process it was clear how my father did not realise he did not vote for all the proposals. So my suggestion would be to have all the proposals that need to be voted *before* the results. Then each proposal evaluated, once evaluated would disappear from before and appear under.

There are several enhancements that can be made following my father feedback, but this is a single simple one that would greatly enhance the experience, and make sure all proposals get voted.

title: Triangle should look nicer
body:
This is related to #6 but it goes further. I have made a short video (only 8.5 MB) to explain well the problems there are with the triangle right now:

https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/2754299/TriangleAndZoom.mov

Basically, 
1) The triangle is not centred (at least on my configuration, macbook pro, Chrome).
2) The triangle is too short on the horizontal side. The vertical is perfect. So we are using the wrong ratio at least for this machine. Not sure how this changes on other machines
3) the grey rectangle is perfect in its dimensions, but the triangle does not finish where the grey triangle finishes
4) when a person sees the triangle at different zoom levels (zooming in or out of a page, for example if he has a very big monitor, or a very small one, or he cannot see very well) the triangle size does not change in a smooth way.

Note also that there is no effective need to keep a grey background around the triangle, so taking that away might not solve the ratio of the triangle, but at least make it look less ugly.

title: dist/material-styleguide.html doesn't load correctly [material-sprint]
body:
In the material-sprint branch, the statically-built version of `material-styleguide.html` (i.e. the version in `dist/material-styleguide.html` created by `gulp`) usually doesn't load correctly from localhost--the main content frame appears to be blank.

To reproduce:

````sh
$ git checkout material-sprint
$ gulp
$ cd dist
$ python -m SimpleHTTPServer
$ open http://localhost:8000/material-styleguide.html # no content in main frame >50% of the time
````

This seems to happen if the browser is able to load the styleguide-demo iframes before sizeDemo() is [able to attach the onload handlers](https://github.com/google/web-starter-kit/blob/material-sprint/app/material-styleguide.html#L174), and so some are never called, which means the `demosLoaded` class is never added to `<body>`. (Which is more likely to happen if loading from localhost, without browser-sync being involved.)

body:
Every time my father wanted to open the voting triangle he would click on the small voting triangle in the question page next to a proposal, which would open the big triangle to vote. This is fine, but he would also try to click on the part of the triangle that represented what he wanted to say. On the green side if he agreed. On the red side if he disagreed. And so on. As those area are tiny it took him considerable time, for something that is pointless since the system was not storing this information at all. Only the vote on the big triangle counts.

Hello Courseplay team,

This idea began while testing #832 "Mais harvesting with poetinger mex 5" and the provided fix. As this is a new question/idea/request I decided to open a new "Issue" instead of placing this in the other thread.

I did a little research and found at Mex5 manufacturer home page (Pöttinger, see also links at the end) that it is also/more common to attach a Mex5 at the back of a tractor and then driving backward at harvest. I tried this configuration in LS 15 together with Courseplay v256...

After I start Coursplay again at transport tractor the transport follows my backward driving harvester (screenshot 2) very good/as expected ;-) ... 

So my question: Is there an easy way to implement something like a "default backward/forward driving" flag to indicate the normal driving direction for such a harvest combine? So the transport would be able to evaluate such a flag and already initially joins in the "right" driving direction...

title: Expand/refactor dynamic filtering
body:
To address one way or another various filed issues: #361, #358, #331, #282, #236, #68.

Definitions:
- "Static filtering" = filters based on ABP net filters syntax, or hosts file entries
    - Disadvantage: Adding/removing filter(s) is CPU/short-term memory expensive
    - Advantage: Can be very fine-grained
- "Dynamic filtering"
    - Advantage: Adding/removing filter(s) is virtually CPU/memory noop relative to static filters
    - Advantage: Very useful to unbreak (or further restrict) web sites without the overhead of static filters
    - Disadvantage: Coarse-grained

Filtering:
- Whitelisting override all dynamic and static filters
- Dynamic exception filters override static and dynamic block filters
- Dynamic block filters override static exception filters and default behavior
- Static exception filters override static block filters
- Static block filters override default behavior
- Default behavior: all net requests are allowed

Filtering precedence inside dynamic filtering -- most specific to least specific:
- Hostname - hostname - any type (new)
- Any - hostname - any type (new)
- Hostname - any - specific type (these already exist)
- Any - any - specific type (these already exist)

UI:
- The default UI will always be minimalist -- just as it is now
- Optionally expand panel to unveil dynamic filtering
- It is not feature bloat, it just expands on the current dynamic filtering (`script`, `iframe`) to address the issues enumerated above.
- Just as now, it is optional, tucked away by default
- But readily available as a very useful tool to help users help themselves

title: mon: provide encoded canonical full OSDMap from primary
body:
Currently we make each monitor apply the incremental and encode the full
map locally.  The original motivation was to save bandwidth, but the
savings are minimal to modest and the complexity associated with doing this
is huge.

This strategy also causes problems now that we have OSDMap crc's and old
mons/clusters may have diverging full OSDMaps due to mixed version
clusters.  See #10422

Instead, include the encoded full map in the paxos transaction.  We will
still apply the incremental and check the crc, but if it fails and we have
the correct version, reload it from disk and move on.  If we don't, we
will continue as we have before--the primary mon doesn't have support for
crc's yet.  When it does we will start verifying and/or get our
full map back into sync.

Fixes: #10422
Signed-off-by: Sage Weil <sage@redhat.com>

title: Hanukkah code review - main.js
body:
**General**
- [x] Line 1: Put `"Handlebars": true` in your `.jshintrc` file, under `globals`
- [x] Variables declarations (add indentation):
```js
// Bad
var one = 13,
two = 20;

// Good
var one = 13,
    two = 20;

// Or - As seen in some libraries 
var
    one = 13,
    two = 20;
```
Read: <http://programmers.stackexchange.com/questions/229694/multiple-var-statements-in-javascript>
- [ ] `$('#quick-reports-panel')` and `$('#my-team-folders-panel')` are repeated several times in the code, better cache them in a variable.
  - [x] Also, you're getting an elm by ID, so `.eq(0)` is redundant.
  - [ ] Also, you can use `$('#quick-reports-panel, #my-team-folders-panel')` to get a jQuery object with both of these elements and put that into a variable, and then use `panels.each()` on that. See [.each](http://api.jquery.com/each/)
  - Note that when using `.each`, a `return` inside it will not halt the outer function.
- [ ] Add comments to blocks of code (inside the big functions)

**UTILS.isEnterOrSpace**
- [x] No need for `e.which`. `e.keyCode` is usually enough, unless you try to capture which Mouse button was clicked (and you're not).

**dataStorage.exportData:**
- [ ] See my 3rd point at the top. Then the `var`'s inside the `for` loop will not hoist to the top
- [ ] You must use `Modernizr` before using `localStorage` (the `if` will not help)
See <http://codepen.io/netcraft/pen/QwbPYb?editors=001>
- [ ] Better save the data under descriptive keys like `formHtml`, `index`, `val`, instead of an array
Then it'll be easier and more clear to fetch the data in `dataStorage.importData`.
This will change how you use the Handlebars Template, instead of `this` you'll have 

**dataStorage.importData:**
- [ ] Modernizr again, and you must use a `try catch` when doing `JSON.parse()`, see the link above.
- [ ] See my 3rd point at the top
- [ ] Add comments to blocks of code

**dropdowns**
- [x] `init`: If you're calling methods of `dropdowns` with that keyword, you can ditch the `this` keyword idea and then you won't need the `call` in `dropdowns.openDropdown.call`.
- [x] `openDropdown`: Ditch the `this`
- [x] `init`: I prefer the `on` variation for event listeners, since it's more explicit, and easier to change to event delegation (optional).

**tabs**
- [x] `this` - Decide how you're using it and be consistent, either `tabs.` or `this.`. Personally, I think that `this` is useful only in Constructors, and here you can call it by name, as in an API.
- [ ] `init`: Ditch the `bind`, not needed since you're already calling it with `tabs` context.
- [x] `init` - Cache `e.target`, even if you were using it once.
- [ ] `init` - Narrow down the `keydown` handling from `document` to something more specific.
- [ ] `getPanel`: If you comment the function, use [JSDoc](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/JSDoc)
- [ ] `updateAria`: Chain methods using `.`. Also, you're using `removeAttr` and after that setting it, just set it and that's it.
- [ ] `activate`: Cache `$('.active-tab')`
- [ ] `hash`: Rename this function to something that describes what it does

**formsBehavior**
- [ ] Ditch the `.bind`, everywhere!
- [ ] `init`: See my 3rd point at the top
- [ ] `escForm`: Use [event delegation](http://codepen.io/netcraft/pen/yyeoJw?editors=001)
- [ ] `escapePress`: Ditch the `e.which`
- [ ] `displayOrHideForm`: Rename to `toggle...`
- [ ] `isValidUrlRegex`: Use the work of others and add a link to the [source](https://mathiasbynens.be/demo/url-regex) (@diegoperini won)
- [ ] `setHttp`: If the URL passes the RE, do nothing, you must not lowercase it, since some URLs are case sensitive (only check if it doesn't pass it).
- [ ] `validateURL`: Rename to `sanitizeURL`, since it's not only validating the URL. See [this](http://drupal.stackexchange.com/questions/1967/what-does-sanitized-mean-in-api-documentation)
- [ ] `fillTabContent`: Use `$.each`
- [ ] `displayWebsites`: See my 3rd point at the top
- [ ] `validateForm`: `something !== ''` is the same as `something`

**searchBox**
- [ ] `init`: This is a form, you can use the `submit` event on it instead of `keydown`, since you only catch the `enter` anyway.

**initSite**
- [ ] What if the file doesn't exist? You should catch it with `.fail` and notify about it.

title: Cross compiler musl
body:
This is a work-in-progress pull-request just so we can comment on it.

Finally I've managed to create a cross-toolchain and use it to compile a runnable NodeOS instance (i386-glibc -> i686-musl, I need to test x86_64 -> i386). After some tries, I got it to work using as basis [Cross Linux From Scratch - Embedded](http://clfs.org/view/clfs-embedded), that uses [musl](http://www.musl-libc.org/) as C lib instead of standard glibc. I wanted to use a glibc based system, but this is the only one I've managed to make it to work, since using the plain [Linux From Scratch](http://www.linuxfromscratch.org/) or also the standard [Compressed Linux From Scratch](http://www.clfs.org/view/CLFS-3.0.0-SYSVINIT/) (both based on glibc) was fairly overcomplicated and gave a lot of compilation problems.

This has some drawbacks that needs improvement (or not :-) ):

* it's a musl based system, so compiled modules that use non-standard extensions of GNU glibc will not compile. It's a fail of the developers, so this could help to improve their code to be C standard compliant (win-win for all :-) ).
* OpenSSL doesn't work well with musl (due to the use of that non-standard extensions...) and needs to be patched since [nobody](https://rt.openssl.org/Ticket/Display.html?id=2823&user=guest&pass=guest) [fix](https://rt.openssl.org/Ticket/Display.html?id=3526&user=guest&pass=guest) [it](https://rt.openssl.org/Ticket/Display.html?id=3123) :-( Luckily [it's an easy one](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/maximeh/buildroot/master/package/openssl/openssl-004-musl-termios.patch)...
* GCC is not aware of musl so [it needs to be patched](http://patches.clfs.org/embedded-dev/gcc-4.7.3-musl-1.patch), too. This leads us to use a fixed GCC version, but since it's somewhat new (April 2014) and probably we'll move to [llvm](http://llvm.org/) when [Linux could be compiled with it](http://llvm.linuxfoundation.org/) so we can use one of the llvm [Javascript](http://badassjs.com/post/39573969361/llvm-js-llvm-itself-compiled-to-javascript-via) [flavours](http://leaningtech.com/cheerp/) on the userspace, then it's a fair trade by this moment.
* I was not be able to use a dynamically linked Node.js executable, so I'm using a [fully-statically linked](https://github.com/joyent/node/pull/8274) one. This should be fixed in the future for loading of compiled modules and specially to exec binaries, but if we don't allow binaries at all and since now ```require()``` of modules works because musl now include the required ```dl_``` functions (at least native ones does while it was not working before, I need to test external ones), this could help to enforce a pure-Javascript environment :-) On the other hand, this also has the advantage that the memory foot-print is smaller since now the only required files on the initramfs are the console device and the Node.js executable (impossible to make it simpler!!! :-D )

It's still unstable and needs some more work and testing (please test it! :-D ), but when it's finished, NodeOS build system will be self-contained and will be easier to port it to other platforms just by updating the cross-compiler :-) Also I've been developing it as a NPM package, so when it's ready in the future we could be able to move it to be an independent project (I would love to see NodeOS self-hosted... :-D ).

title: Should I make this module a plugin?
body:
I made a colored `echo` based command; `msg` for a plugin I am currently working on. It could be useful to other users so I was thinking I should make it a plugin instead. Basically it can do something like this:

```
msg !! Error! -- Well, this is embarrassing...
msg ++ OK -- File ~~ $filename -- downloaded to :/ $directory
msg Visit → :// http://github.com
msg @orchid Dream @chocolate in @cornsilk Technicolor
msg Line1 == Line2 == Line3 ======= Line9
msg @random Only @random God @random Knows
msg @bad Bad @dad Dad @ff0 ":)"
msg _ Underline __ Bold ___ Underline and Bold FTW
```

![sample](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8317250/5555028/4817de3e-8ccf-11e4-93d4-3dd57e1f47bc.png)



Here is the `man` page. If you think this is plugin worthy I will submit a PR.

```
    __ _  ___ ___ _
   /  ' \(_-</ _ `/
  /_/_/_/___/\_, /
            /___/ v0.1.0

 NAME
      msg - technicolor message printer

 SYNOPSIS
      msg [-s] [-- -n --normal] [~~ -i --info] [_ -u --under]
          [__ -b --bold] [___] [++ -k --ok --success] [!! -e --error]
          [:// -w --www --url --mail] [:/ -d --dir] [== -l --line-break]
          [=== + \n][@<RRGGBB>] [<text>]

 OPTIONS
      -s
          Should be first if used. Do not separate arguments with spaces.

      -n
          Should be first if used. Do not output a newline at the end of
          the message.

 STYLES
      --   -n --normal              Normal/Default
      ~~   -i --info                Information
      _    -u --under               Underline
      __   -b --bold                Bold
      ___  -bu -ub                  Bold and Underline
```

title: fix(scroll): ignore events during slide-box slide
body:
I don't expect this PR to be merged. @mhartington [mentioned](http://forum.ionicframework.com/t/beta-14-slide-box-limit-scroll-whilst-sliding/14393/3) there was a refactoring of the slidebox going on, so this probably isn't aligned with those efforts. Nonetheless, I thought it might be helpful for others affected by the "scroll leak" introduced in beta 14.

The details of the bug can be found in various issues on the forum:

- http://forum.ionicframework.com/t/beta14-slide-box-vertical-scroll-behaviour
- http://forum.ionicframework.com/t/beta-14-slide-box-limit-scroll-whilst-sliding
- http://forum.ionicframework.com/t/ion-content-scroll-locking-doesnt-work

The implementation followed the lead of `ionic.scroll.isScrolling` by introducing `ionic.slide.isSliding` so that the two may communicate as necessary. isSliding turns on during a slide view's `touchmove` and off in `touchend`. When isSliding is true, it interrupts any scroll view scrolling events.

Tests didn't break, but I also didn't add any tests (back to not thinking this would be merged). If I was mistaken, or this is terrible for other reasons I cannot see, please let me know!

Thanks, and Happy Holidays ionic team!

title: Stpl less slicing
body:
Here's another one dependant on #690

The regexes claimed to match "start of line" when in fact, they did not.By using `.search(s, pos=p)` over `.search(s[p:])`, this now works correctly. This allows the special casing of ternary if to be removed.

The previous regex would allow `% if True: foo() end`, the new one requires `% if True: foo(); end`, which seems to be what the old regex intended anyway.

title: Should be able to specify ssh key by fingerprint
body:
When creating a droplet you should be able to give a key fingerprint to Droplet.create(). The current code tries to interpret any string as an actual public key.

Adding an additional check to see if it's a fingerprint, instead of a full public key, after finding a string in Droplet.__get_ssh_keys_id and then directly adding the fingerprint to the id list allows it to work.

title: [Vote] Which authentification mechanisms should we provide?
body:
We currently provide:

- "formed based" authentication with Spring Security, which we have extended so you can invalidate sessions, have a better cookie theft feature, etc...
- OAuth2 authentification, which requires us to have our own server side implementation in MongoDB (and soon in Cassandra)

Both options are good and are two different approaches.

Now we have 4 other options that are currently opened tickets:

- #684 Support Spring Social
- #813 Use Json Web Tokens
- #892 x-auth-token authentication method
- #903 use Angular Token

Obviously, we can't support all of them, so we need to choose. From my personal point of view, what we already have is good enough, and I don't know if those other mechanisms are good/secured/useful.

So I'm opening this ticket to start a discussion and a vote, and close the mechanisms that we will not support.

title: Proposal to change the default navigating behaviour of tiddlywiki
body:
[also discussed at: https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/tiddlywiki/yjnEQiHb-oM]

Hello,

After careful considerations, I want to make this proposal to change the default navigating behaviour of tiddlywiki. Please excuse the bold markup, markdown doesn't support underline and I wanted to highlight certain points. Also the arguments are not meant to be rude in any way, it is just an attempt to improve the behaviour of our great tiddlywiki :)

### The problem setup

Let's say I have 3 Tiddlers open

A // *fully displayed in the window*
B // *partly displayed in the window*
C // *not displayed; too far down*
D // *not displayed; too far down*

Unless D is not larger than the page height, clicking on the D-link in the "Open" Tiddlers Panel will **not** scroll D to the top of the viewport but only scroll so far down that D is fully displayed with all it's content.

### Why is this bad?

* This is not a standard web behavior: When using internal website links to page anchors (#), any browser will scroll **always** until the anchor is **at the top of the page** and not just till it is in the viewport somewhere at the bottom.
* It is the philosophy of tiddlywiki to create tiddlers with small information chunks and link them. So when **aiming at creating a wiki with tiddlers all having small content bodies**, and navigating to these tiddlers, they may **not be immediately recognized after the navigation-scroll** as the **user always looks at the top of the webpage first** where he/she expects the content to be and the **navigated tiddler might instead be displayed at the very very bottom**.
* Referring to the example given above, if Tiddler C has a size of 70% of the page height and D 30% then the user might think he/she falsely scrolled to C instead of D since D is displayed at the top.
* Frameworks like bootstrap use "hot zones" to unfold the table of contents on the sidbar if an anchor makes it into the "hot zone" (scroll this site for an example http://getbootstrap.com/components/). If an anchor link is clicked, the anchor is focused at the top (in the hot zone) and the toc unfolds. In tiddlywiki, this is not possible, because we never know if a tiddler that is navigated to makes it to the top unless its body is longer than the pageheight or it is newly opened. So it is not possible to define a zone where we can say "this tiddler in the story-river is currently focussed" to trigger an event.

### Conclusion

It would be great if we could change the current navigating behavior of tiddlywiki in a way that tiddlers, whether navigated to or freshly opened, are always scrolled so that the tiddler frame's top is always at the viewport top. **This facilitates user orientation and allows programmers to know where "navigated" tiddlers will appear.**

Regards Felix

**edit:** Discussing this with mat, I want to make this addition to the proposal:

After a user clicked a local-link in a tiddler body, TiddlyWiki should navigate to the tiddler as proposed above (if it exists in the story river) or insert the tiddler above the currently focused tiddler and navigate to this tiddler. This way there is not "empty wiki experience" and the behavior is consistent with other opening actions (e.g. when clicking a link of the "search" to open this tiddler it is inserted at the very top, not at the bottom)

title: Bookmark duplicates policy
body:
When a bookmark is saved and user navigates on the same page and clicks on the address field star or chooses "Add bookmark" from the menu, a dialogue informs the user that such bookmark already exists. When the user chooses to continue from there, a new bookmark dialogue opens up. 

I have a suggestion to enhance this behaviour with an option in about:config AllowDuplicateBookmarks true/false. Both options would give the same warning as described, but when the duplicates policy is set to "false", the new bookmark dialogue would contain the existing bookmark data. 

I mean, when AllowDuplicateBookmarks is false, then selecting "Add bookmark" on a page already bookmarked, the user would see the existing bookmark edit dialogue, not adding a new dialogue. 

And the "This bookmark already exists. Continue?" dialogue should have three options: 1. Yes 2. Cancel 3. Never show this message again

And about:config should contain an option to get the dialogue back.

title: Forked version
body:
Hello again,

This pull request is to let you know about the rework I have done on Pilot Assistant, which might contain some things of interest.

I have refactored most of the code, some changes include:
  * Using "private" instead of "internal" in most places. 
  * Reducing tight coupling between components.
  * Tried to separate GUI drawing and behavioural stuff.

Other changes include:
  * My original GUI changes.
  * The SAS GUI has been redone, and should (hopefully) be simpler to understand. 
  * Text fields now have input lock, this blocks vessel control and time warp.
  * Also SAS an PA were modified to also respect these input locks.
  * Files for building on Linux (using xbuild)
  * Maintained feature parity with your version. 

Overall the code base is quite different in many ways, and I shall continue to maintain my version.

Matthew.

title: Issue90 type information
body:
Cary,

First try of the type information. It seems quite stable, been using it for a few days (provided the configuration is correct, I suppose, didn't test what happens when ghc-modi is not correctly configured).

I bound the type info call to the DocumentationProvider as well as to an action (alt - equals, like scala). I prefer the action, I think the documentation provider doesn't work so well. There are tests of the parsing of the output of ghc-modi, but not really of the documentationprovider, basically because of the abundance of static calls and the fact that I think they can only be mocked while testing, and statics can only be mocked through Powermock if I recall correctly, which would mean an extra test dependency and so on and so forth, so I left that to be your call.

Also, there is a weird behaviour that getting the editor creates a stack trace of around 5 kilometers long, something that seems like a threading issue, but the function seems to work. I don't really know why the stack trace happens, all the more because it only happens when calling the type information through the documentation provider (same code path is used when the action is called, but no stack trace). Maybe you know more what could go wrong, it looks like something intellij-related.

So, consider this a "request for comment" more than a pull request ;-)

Kasper

title: go/ssa/interp: breaks on reflect implementation of Go tip
body:
Running ssadump on [this go program](http://play.golang.org/p/JHUgaI-2sq) produces a panic: 

    panic: interface conversion: interface is reflect.rtype, not *reflect.rtype

With go gc 1.4 on GNU/Linux there is none. 

The full invocation, output produced, and golang version is given in [this gist](https://gist.github.com/rocky/6f4f1955cdf8addaeb92). 

Looking at the Go code:

    u8 reflect.Type = reflect.TypeOf(uint8(0))
    byteSlice reflect.Type = reflect.SliceOf(u8)

I am just as confused as ssadump. Here is *reflect.SliceOf* in *reflect/type.go*:

    func SliceOf(t Type) Type {
    typ := t.(*rtype)
    ...

The ssadump error message makes sense to me in that the passed-in type is a `reflect.rtype`, not and `*reflect.rtype` which is what  appears to be the use in *reflect.SliceOf*. 

So what is it in Go that makes it okay to have these things not give a type error?

I've added an extra paragraph, appropriate DDOC tags (Examples, Params, Returns), and changed the template type parameters to match the type parameters for std.algorithm.splitter. I also renamed the delimiter parameter to 'sep' to match std.array.join which follows this (std.algorthim.splitter calls it 's' instead).

I'm not sure about the description of the returned array. Should it be called an 'array of ranges'?

Finally, I think the version of the template that has the 'alias isTerminator' needs to be documented separately, but I haven't figured out yet what that template alias is doing.

title: 検索無しでも見やすい挟み込みリストを作る
body:
## 理由
検索途中まで作ってみたけど、正直いらない。
理由は二つ。
* 普段から譜面みてるから、50~60行から必要情報探すのは苦ではない。
  むしろ検索条件考えるほうがめんどい

* ユーザーが挟み込み先を探す流れを検討し直したため。
  挟み込み先を最終的に確定させるのは楽団員（挟み込みに行く人）であり、
  その人が決断する理由はユーザーと異なる可能性がある。
  そのため、挟み込みリストの段階で絞り込んでしまうと、
  本来挟み込める楽団員が居た演奏会を省いてしまう危険性がある。
  このことから検索機能はユーザーの主目的である「演奏会の集客」に
  不利益を与える危険性があることから、破棄することとした。

## 実現したいこと

* 日付の区切りはハッキリと
* 各列（特に曲目、場所）は上から流し見で把握できること
 * DONE:文章を改行表示できる
 * 横スクロール操作は行わせない
   * 動作が増えて手間
    * ユーザーが楽団情報を読むのは「この楽団に挟み込みに行くor行かないの判断をする」
　ことが目的であり、それを最速で達成するためには、全情報が画面内にあることが必要なため。
* DONE:最寄り駅、場所情報いれなきゃなぁ
 * DONE:会場情報に会場名入れる
 * DONE:最寄り駅に最寄り駅情報入れる
   * DONE:そのためのDB作る
* 日付は外だししよう
* DONEスクレイピングエラーと向き合う
 * 保留：エンコーディングエラー
 * DONE元サイト楽団HPのリンク切れ
   * DONE:2014/1１件目、楽団HPが現在ページを指している

## メモ
* これらが出来たら吹奏楽、合唱、演劇にも波及
  ※仮説※
  市民文化ホールでやるようなイベントは総じて挟み込みしているのかな？
  →調査しよう
* 東京外の演奏会はどうするかな？
  →東京外のひとも使うから排除するのは忍びないけど、
      リンクで外だしするのは全体のスピード感を損なう。
      どうしたものかなぁ。注釈でもいれとこうかなぁ。

title: one way to add molar_mass for SolidSolution
body:
The new solid solution didn't have a molar_mass defined. Here is a proposal to have molar_mass as an attribute of Mineral and not as a function, which I think might be the more correct way, but maybe not the most user-friendly. Other ways without removing Mineral.molar_mass() might be:
- define a params dictionary for SolidSolution
- put an if statement for SolidSolution in Mineral.molar_mass()
neither of which I think is pretty. Unfortunately, what is not very elegant in my solution is that Mineral.molar_mass is now defined in the set_method function (cannot be done in __init__ in case someone defines an empty Mineral())

As a side, I commented out a test in test_spin.py that used a pt_dependent mineral, as these now fail and we have already excluded other examples because of this.

title: [IMPORTANT] Repo split and new continuous- integration bot
body:
Due to Travis not being flexible enough (and also very slow), me and hakan have setup a Jenkins server that tracks PRs and also builds CKAN/ NetKAN from master. It works pretty much the same as Travis except it's a lot faster, more reliable and configurable.

The following repositories are tracked for changes. All PRs will be built and you will see the build result the same way it was with Travis.
- [CKAN-core](http://github.com/KSP-CKAN/CKAN-core)
- [CKAN-cmdline](http://github.com/KSP-CKAN/CKAN-cmdline) 
- [CKAN-GUI](http://github.com/KSP-CKAN/CKAN-GUI) 
- [CKAN-netkan](http://github.com/KSP-CKAN/CKAN-netkan)
- [CKAN-meta](http://github.com/KSP-CKAN/CKAN-meta)
- [NetKAN](http://github.com/KSP-CKAN/NetKAN)

The server itself is at http://ci.ksp-ckan.org, you can login using your GitHub account.
The latest ckan.exe can be found [here](http://128.199.40.123:8080/job/CKAN/lastSuccessfulBuild/artifact/ckan.exe).
Latest netkan.exe is [here](http://128.199.40.123:8080/job/NetKAN/lastSuccessfulBuild/artifact/netkan.exe).
You can follow the Jenkins build logs in #ckan-jenkins at irc.esper.net.
All CKAN/ NetKAN merges get automatic releases in the [CKAN-nightly repo](https://github.com/KSP-CKAN/CKAN-nightly/releases).

The replacement for `.travis.yml` comes in the form of a simple bash script associated with each project called `build.sh`.

What works?
- Pretty much everything
- NUnit tests
- PRs are tracked and reported on
- PRs to the NetKAN PR will be inflated with the latest netkan.exe and installed with the latest ckan.exe (hooray!)
- PRs to the CKAN-meta PR will be installed with the latest ckan.exe

What's doesn't?
- All tests that use 'prove' are not implemented, need @pjf 's help on this one
- MirrorKAN needs to be patched
- GitHub releases

**Final verdict  =>  from PR to build in 15 seconds instead of 5 minutes.**

title: add support for new platforms - mt6595
body:
Hi Bruno,
I updated your tools to support new MTK platforms, which require to pass extra arguments (offsets) in repacking command line. For this the script will create a new file "boot.img-Args.txt" - as example for boot image - will copy in it values like this: "--base 0x10000000 --pagesize 2048 --kernel_offset 0x00008000 --ramdisk_offset 0x01000000 --second_offset 0x00f00000 --tags_offset 0x00000100". They will be shown on the screen also. At repacking all these are passed in command and the resulting image will work in these new phones. It has no impact on older platforms - I tested this myself, and for new platform was tested in zopo zp999 thread. Additionally I created a new script which will only show image infos, if there is no need to unpack it. I compiled again all binaries modules to support these extra arguments, and also I compiled the required modules for info script. I couldn't do it for OSX, but I have the repo with boot-info in my gihub if you can build it. Also mkbootimg has to be compiled again for OSX to accept extra arguments.
Liviu

title: RC param tune
body:
This enables changing parameters with RC potentiometer knobs. Tested in HIL. More documentation will follow.

Testers: note the new RC_MAP_PARAM1 (2, 3) parameters which tell the system which rc channels can be used.

Depends on https://github.com/mavlink/mavlink/pull/309 and will hence not pass travis. As soon as the mavlink PR is in I will update the submodule here.

Includes https://github.com/PX4/Firmware/pull/1542

title: Quarry Crash - Extra Utilities 1.2.1
body:
Below is the crash dump if you want to skip the verbose report.

I am playing Material Energy^4 (v0.7.0). Note that it comes with Extra Utilities 1.2.0, but I tried swapping that out with 1.2.1 and it still crashes upon loading my world. I setup a quarry inside the spatial IO chamber.

I built a quarry with these connections: Silk upgrade, Hole upgrade, Speed 3 upgrade, Tesseract (#1) - receiving energy, sending items/fluids. Tesseract (#2) - sending energy, receiving items/fluids. Approximately 5 chucks apart. AE2 ME Interface next to Tesseract (#2), attached to ME drive with one 4k empty storage device, and power adapter thingy, plus 1 crafting terminal. 10k RF/t Big Reactor providing power to Tesseract & adapter thingy via single Ender IO 20k power cable. No other Tesseracts on that channel (2), but there are three other Tesseracts, all on channel (1) - different power supply (20 64x solar generators).

First I created a new world and used creative cheats to build the above quarry. It was identical in configuration. It worked without any problems.

Next I built the quarry into my 'real' world. Although the physical location is identical, the world below was different (A different spatial IO disk was loaded into the chamber--this time Miner's Delight). Everything was connected, tesseract #1 configured as above, etc. but it wasn't working. I had left out one thing: Configuring Tesseract #2 send/receive. It was set to send ALL, I quickly clicked it into receive (only) items and fluids (the correct configuration), and that was the moment it crashed.

It now crashes the moment I attempt load the world.

title: Include Respond.js
body: [Respond.js](https://github.com/scottjehl/Respond) is a fast & lightweight polyfill for min/max-width CSS3 Media Queries (for IE 6-8, and more), which is required for Bootstrap 2.3.0 + support in IE7 and above. Does this library already include it? If not, is there any plans to do so?

title: Add other oauth options
body:
See what other options are good to implement. 

In case of Twitter we need to remember that they don't facilitate a e-mail address of the user. So after the sign-up we still need to ask for the users e-mail address and verify this.

title: Google and Facebook sign up have wrong symbols
body:
The Google button has an **f** for Facebook and the Facebook button has a **g** for Google. These need to be the other way round.
![sign up issue](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9398950/5567713/9a29a95a-8f4a-11e4-8bed-ba2430453406.jpg)

title: Upload failure using Lychee with Safari
body:
Hello,

I've installaed Lychee on a raspberry Pi using the following steps: 

1) apt-get update && apt-get upgrade -y
2) apt-get install php5-fpm php5-gd libgd2-xpm libpcrecpp0 libxpm4
3) apt-get install nginx
4) mkdir /var/www
4) mount /dev/sda1 /var/www (filesystems in ext4)
5) chown -R www-data:www-data /var/www
6) apt-get install -y php5-mysql mysql-server
7)Modify /etc/php5/fpm/php.ini by adding the following:

extension = php_mbstring.dll
extension = php_exif.dll
extension = php_gd2.dll
max_execution_time = 200
post_max_size = 200M
upload_max_size = 200M
upload_max_filesize = 20M
max_file_uploads = 100

8) service php5-fpm restart
9) apt-get install -y git
10) 
cd /var/www
git clone https://github.com/electerious/Lychee.git
mv Lychee/* .
rm -rf Lychee/

rm /etc/nginx/sites-available/default
11) vi  /etc/nginx/sites-available/lychee: 
server {
root /var/www;
index index.php index.html index.htm;
location ~ .php$ {
    fastcgi_pass unix:/var/run/php5-fpm.sock;
    fastcgi_index index.php;
    include fastcgi_params;
}
}
12) service nginx restart 
13) ln -s /etc/nginx/sites-available/lychee /etc/nginx/sites-enabled/lychee


-Lychee is up and running then, What informations do I need to provide for the database?

-Where can I find the user/password and modify it afterwards in the database?

-I'm unable to upload pictures in the different directories (error 413) when trying with Safari.

Thank for your help

Reported by: @Lockzi

Issue:

On my clean Ubuntu 14.04.1 install I ran RetroRig
<Lockzi> It is stuck on '/home/administrator/RetroRig/XBMC-cfgs/extra/RetroRig.desktop' -> '/home/administrator/.config/autostart/RetroRig.desktop'
<Lockzi> I also see multiple: sed: can't read /home/administrator/.retrorig/.dolphin-emu/Wii/Config/WiimoteNew.ini: No such file or directory

title: Start health checks of all running app versions after leader change
body:
Before only the current version's health checks were started on leader change,
leading to missing health checks when, e.g. after scaling, when old app versions
were still running.

Fixes #912

title: introduce mount points
body:
one or more root directories to scan

change prune to detect files no longer in the collection due to the mount being removed. 

should be a function for detecting if file path is in mount path.

title: --bail
body: though it was in `bulk` already, but it would be cool if `--bail` could be given to exit on a non-0 exit code.

title: pws doesn't work with ruby 2.2 because of cannot load such file -- digest/hmac (LoadError)
body: ```/home/rupert/.rvm/rubies/ruby-2.2.0/lib/ruby/2.2.0/rubygems/core_ext/kernel_require.rb:54:in `require': cannot load such file -- digest/hmac (LoadError)```

title: Conditional proposal
Critical chance values for warrior.
body:
The critical chance agility gives you is incorrect, it should be 0.05% per agility point for warrior.
In Addition, there should be a basic critical strike you start with (it should be 5%)

(etc if a warrior has 3 agility, he should have 5% + (3x0.05%) = 5.15% critical strike chance

body: Hie, Add me as an owner in this repo.

title: Add round-side support
body: For possibility to rounding needed sides only.

title: Player Location Glitching
body: People for some reason like to mine strait down, (stupid idea) and usually when they mine a block, the block reappears several times and they suffocate. Another glitch, when players walk forward casually, all the sudden they are teleported back. They can't move at all. Their screen vibrates as they walk forward. We decided that jumping while walking works, but it is very annoying. The walking glitch happens when you walk every few seconds. It's very common. These glitches are extremely annoying, and I would like you to fix them.

title: Draft of the JavaScript style guide for Ember
body:
Related to #9849

- [x] use spaces after the keyword in block statements (https://github.com/emberjs/ember.js/pull/10073)
  - [x] `requireSpaceBeforeKeywords`
  - [x] `requireSpaceAfterKeywords`
- [ ] use spaces before block statements (https://github.com/emberjs/ember.js/pull/10095)
  - [ ] `requireSpaceBeforeBlockStatements`
- [ ] use spaces in ternary conditional statements
- [ ] use spaces in functional declarations
- [ ] disallows space before () in call expressions
- [ ] require block statements to be on a new line
- [ ] disallow block statements from beginning and ending with 2 newlines
- [ ] use empty line above the specified keywords unless the keyword is the first expression in a block statement
- [ ] disallow empty block statements
- [ ] disallow space after opening array square bracket and before closing
- [ ] disallow space after opening round bracket and before closing
- [x] disallow spaces before semicolons (https://github.com/emberjs/ember.js/pull/10084)

cc @rwjblue

title: Add "unit" tests that test against parsed code
body:
Implements Issue #22.

Under `tests/Psecio/Parse`, implemented `ParseTest.php`,
`ParseTestVisitor.php` and `Tests/TestSessionRegenFalse_ParseTest.php` (yeah,
crazy name there. May need to figure out a better naming convention).

* `ParseTest.php` implements an abstract base class for all the parsing-based
  tests.
* `ParseTestVisitor.php` implements a simple parse tree visitor for use in
  testing.
* `Tests/TestSessionRegenFalse_ParseTest.php` implements several parse string
  tests for `TestSessionRegenFalse`, including one for the problem I found and
  fixed in PR #15.
* `Tests/TestAvoidGlobalsUse_ParseTest.php` implements parse string tests for
  `TestAvoidGlobalsUse`.

Implementing a test is as simple as creating a test case that extends
`\tests\Psecio\Parse\ParseTest`. It must implement `parseSampleProvider()` and
`buildTest()`. The `buildTest()` method should return an instance of the unit
under test (e.g. `TestSessionRegenFalse`). Then `parseSampleProvider()` should
return a list of PHP code string (with initial `<?php` omitted) and result
pairs. Each PHP code string will be parsed, with the results evaluated against
the results of `buildTest()` via the `PhpParser\NodeTraverser`. If the results
match the result value, the test passes. Otherwise, it fails.

title: More comprehensive test coverage
body:
This would make a whole bunch of good "first contribution" projects, and does not require deep insider knowledge of the language.

The basic idea is to expand the test suite to make sure that julia's base code works as promised. Here is one recommended way to contribute toward this goal:

1. Make sure you have an up-to-date git checkout and are on the `master` branch. Build julia with `make`

2. From the top-level directory, type `rm usr/lib/julia/sys.so`. Deleting `sys.so` will prevent julia from using any pre-compiled functions, increasing the accuracy of the results. (This also makes startup a bit slower, but that's fine for this test---and once you're done, simply typing `make` will cause this file to be rebuilt).

3. Via the command prompt, navigate to julia's `test/` directory

4. Start julia with `JULIA_CPU_CORES=1 julia --code-coverage=all --inline=no`. This restricts julia to a single process (accumulating all measurements of coverage together), and prevents inlining (inlining makes it difficult to accurately assess whether a function has been tested).

5. From the julia prompt, type `include("runtests.jl")`

6. Once the tests complete successfully, quit julia

7. Navigate to the `base/` directory.

8. Browse through the *.jl.cov files, and look for functions (or branches within functions) that either have `0` in front of them (indicating that they were run 0 times), or have `-` in front of them (indicating that they were never compiled).

9. Write a test that exercises some function that is not adequately covered---you can add your test to one of the existing files, or start a new one, whichever seems most appropriate to you. http://julia.readthedocs.org/en/latest/stdlib/test/ may be helpful in explaining how the testing infrastructure works. Submit the test as a pull request (see [CONTRIBUTING.md](https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md)).
